nl.bluejayeindhoven.bjcomm

Class CommunicationInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.bluejayeindhoven.bjcomm.CommunicationInterface
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Publisher, Subscriber

    public abstract class CommunicationInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    Main abstract interface for interfaces that can communicate

    All other interfaces need to extend this class. It contains the ZMQ context and the socket that the communication interface uses. Also provides a way to identify that an interface is running (the socket is available). Subclasses shall ensure that the running boolean is set correctly.

    • Field Summary

      The context of ZMQ to access other objects.

    • Field Detail

      • IO_THREADS

        public static final int IO_THREADS
        Tune the amount of threads the interface shall use. In normal cases using more than one thread will not increase performance.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • context

        protected org.zeromq.ZMQ.Context context
        The context of ZMQ to access other objects. This class will ensure that this object is available

      • socket

        protected org.zeromq.ZMQ.Socket socket
        Socket that will internally be used by interface. Will be initialized to a null pointer. Shall be pointed to a working socket if start finished properly. Shall be deinitialized after stop is called.

      • running

        protected boolean running
        Determines if this interface is usable. At least the socket should work properly before this is set to true. The interface is free to trigger any error if any other method any than start/stop/isRunning is called before this is true.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommunicationInterface

        public CommunicationInterface()
        Initializes communication interface

    • Method Detail

      • isRunning

        public final boolean isRunning()
        Check if the interface is running
        Returns:
        if the interface is running (the running boolean has been set to true by subclasses)

      • start

        public abstract boolean start()
        Starts the interface. If this succeeds isRunning shall also return true from that moment.
        Returns:
        if the interface was succesfully started (shall return false if already started)

      • stop

        public boolean stop()
        Stops the interface. If this succeeds isRunning shall also return false. Normally this shall never fail, in an invalid state the interface shall still be closed
        Returns:
        if the interface was succesfully stopped (shall return false if already stopped)
